item.title: Alternatives to Kubernetes
item.author: patrickdeutsch@gmail.com (Patrick Deutsch)
item.description: Alternatives to Kubernetes Serverless Suppose you are a developer working on a small application with a simple backend handling a limited number of API endpoints. In such cases, you can use serverless architectures, like AWS Lambda and API Gateway, to create a scalable and cost-effective backend that serves requests on demand. Let’s briefly explore some serverless resources: AWS Lambda: A serverless compute service that allows you to run code without provisioning or managing servers.

item.title: When to NOT use Kubernetes
item.author: patrickdeutsch@gmail.com (Patrick Deutsch)
item.description: When Kubernetes Might Not Be the Best Choice Have you ever wondered if using a Kubernetes for a small to medium scale application is worth the complexity and overhead? In many cases, the benefits might not outweigh the costs (financial or emotional) or the added complexity needed to maintain a Kubernetes platform, particularly when the applications require few resources and have low traffic volume. When does Kubernetes make sense for your application?
